meanings.definition: The act of breathing in and out.
meanings.sent1: After running, she took a deep beath to catch her breath.
meanings.sent2: The doctor instructed him to take a slow beath to calm down.
meanings.sent3: During the yoga class, they focused on their beath to relax.
meanings.sent4: The fresh beath of air outside was invigorating.
meanings.sent5: His beath was steady and calm, showing his inner peace.

meanings.definition: A single unit of sound in a rhythmic pattern.
meanings.sent1: The drummer played a loud beath to start the song.
meanings.sent2: The music teacher explained the importance of each beath in a song.
meanings.sent3: The beath of the drum echoed through the room, setting the rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The beath of the music was so catchy, everyone started dancing.
meanings.sent5: Each beath of the drum added to the excitement of the performance.

meanings.definition: To defeat or overcome someone in a competition.
meanings.sent1: She trained hard to beath her opponent in the race.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together to beath the reigning champions.
meanings.sent3: He used his skills to beath his friend in a friendly game of chess.
meanings.sent4: The underdog managed to beath the favorite in a surprising turn of events.
meanings.sent5: With determination, they were able to beath all odds and win the match.

meanings.definition: The past tense of the verb 'beat'.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the hero emerged victorious after a fierce beath.
meanings.sent2: The beath of the drums signaled the end of the battle.
meanings.sent3: The beath of the heart quickened as the tension rose.
meanings.sent4: With a final beath, the villain was defeated and peace restored.
meanings.sent5: The beath of the past echoed through the present, shaping their future.
